Comment:
This game is an instructive one in the sense that it features a simple king + pawn vs king ending. 

Ideas applied 

how to win KPvsK endgames

1. Gain opposition
2. Advance pawn to the 2nd last rank
3. force zugwig
4. promote pawn

one of the strengths of sicilian from black's point of view is that he can setup a meriad of pawn structures to suit his style of play. Here I am aiming for a hedgehog formation with pawns on e6, d6 and a6.

I played this to test white and see what kind of mood he was in. If he follows up with g4 then I know he wants to fight.

A solid line but this move does not give black too much trouble. In fact it allows black to achieve his openning objectives unmalested.

putting the bishop on e3 instead of G5 is becoming very fashionable lately. It is easy to understand why because on g5 the bishop get harassed and white has not really gotten any serious advantage from it. Plus the bishop on e3 is actually more flexible than on g5. From here it eyes the d4 square and can assist with queenside attacking stratagies.

an exicting idea but a bit too aggressive. The forced move for black Qb8 is actually not to bad because the queen is well position on the b8-h2 diagonal and can support pawn thrusts from safety. The disadvantage of Qb8 is that the A rook is going to be hard to develop.

The gameknot database overwhelmingly favors this position for black. If there is an improvement on this line it is here. Something like 10. a4

planning to deal with the knight on b5 but first I take care of defense.

As white I would be expecting 11. ...a6 but the problem is how do you get an advantage out of it?

11. f4 a6 12. Nd4 h6 13. Qd2 and black has 13. ...Nxd4= 13. ...b5 13. ...Qc7 as options
11. Nd4 a6 12. f4 h6 12. Qd2 =
the problem of 10.a3 is now evident. Normally white can retreat his knight to a3 in order to avoid teh exchange and to reorganize via b1 or c4.
both ...Nxd4 and 12. ...e5 create a serious weakness on d6
both ...Nxd4 and 12. ...e5 create a serious weakness on d6
my position is a bit cramped so the exchagne of pieces is in order
my position is a bit cramped so the exchagne of pieces is in order

As a result of the exchange white's centre has been weakened. However, my main problem is my lack of mobilty so I have to open the game up further to increase my advantage of the bishop pair. Plus white's king pawns are starting to look dangerous.
